alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 9:32PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado and west central Wallace Counties in west central Kansas through 1015 PM MDT... At 931 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Cheyenne Wells, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph, dime to nickel size hail, and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado and west central Wallace Counties in west central Kansas, including the following locations... Arapahoe. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 147 and 152, and between mile markers 167 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
